    • Constructor Detail

      • LoadingStorage

        protected LoadingStorage(Database<K,R> database,
                         Executor executor,
                         UnaryOperator<com.google.common.cache.CacheBuilder<Object,Object>> builder)
        Constructs a storage with specified loading cache options options. It's highly recommended to define the invalidation conditions here.

        Using any TaskContext.SYNC executor from BukkitExecutor will stop bukkit main thread while accessing any data from a database.

        The removal listener and cache loader can be modified by overriding cacheLoader() or removalListener()

        Parameters:
        database - the database to send and receive information
        executor - this executor to be used for all asynchronous calls,
        builder - a unary operator that will be applied when building the cache.

      • stats

        public com.google.common.cache.CacheStats stats()
        Returns a current snapshot of this cache's cumulative statistics. All stats are initialized to zero, and are monotonically increasing over the lifetime of the cache.
        Returns:
        the cache stats

      • refresh

        public void refresh(K key)
        Loads a new value for key key, possibly asynchronously. While the new value is loading the previous value (if any) will continue to be returned by get(key) unless it is evicted. If the new value is loaded successfully it will replace the previous value in the cache; if an exception is thrown while refreshing the previous value will remain, and the exception will be logged (using Logger) and swallowed.

        Caches loaded by a CacheLoader will call CacheLoader.reload(K, V) if the cache currently contains a value for key, and CacheLoader.load(K) otherwise. Loading is asynchronous only if CacheLoader.reload(K, V) was overridden with an asynchronous implementation.

        Returns without doing anything if another thread is currently loading the value for key. If the cache loader associated with this cache performs refresh asynchronously then this method may return before refresh completes.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to be refreshed
        Since:
        11.0

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(K key)
        Discards any cached value for key key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be invalidated

      • size

        public long size()
        Returns:
        the approximate number of entries in this cache.
